file_content.text: The Empire owes you everything.
This is not the place for celebration. Meet me in my bunker.
General Hesker will fly you to battle.
Prepare to strike Darth Malgus, then meet me in my bunker.
Grand Moff, it's Malgus. On the HoloNet.
This better be good.
Fellow Sith. Citizens of the Empire.
Too long the strength of the Empire has been beholden to the in-fighting of the Dark Council and the disappearance of an apathetic Emperor.
Sith, children of Sith and warriors everywhere, I declare a new Empire, open to all who long for conquest, freedom from inhibition and the right to follow their passions.
What does he think he's doing!
The Dark Council is dissolved. Those who would join Darth Serevin in supporting me, cast aside your titles and let me lead you to victory.
Those who will not, prepare to face our stealth armada. The Emperor is gone. His station and power are mine. We will conquer the galaxy while the Emperor sleeps.
Once he controls the stealth armada, he'll be almost unstoppable.
Malgus must be stopped.
Malgus makes some good points.
Not a bad speech.
Are you mad? The last thing the Empire needs is a civil war.
What happened to the Emperor?
The Emperor is gone?
The Jedi staged a massive assault, and the Emperor went silent. That is all I know.
If Malgus is able to construct the stealth armada, he'll be unstoppable.
I know I've asked too much of you already, but this "new Empire" can't succeed. I need your help to stop Darth Malgus.
I didn't work my way up to the Dark Council just to have this fool pull the rug out from under me.
You'll have it.
It's an insult to the Sith, to the Empire.
There is only one Emperor, and it's not Malgus.
You'll have it.
I will never bow to a usurper.
A divided Empire will be destroyed.
You'll have it.
I wish you weren't so right.
Taking out Darths never gets old.
You'll have it.
Then you ought to enjoy yourself.
You'll have whatever you need.
Whatever I can do.
Thank you.
I don't like being betrayed.
He'll pay.
Doing the Dark Council's work, he said.
I will convene an emergency war council. Take this time to prepare for battle, then meet me in my bunker. Darth Malgus will not survive this day.
I don't care what you have to do, Major. Find Malgus and find that fleet!
Admiral Shai is dead and the crystal supplies secured.
My mission's complete.
How can you lose an entire fleet?
Find the fleet?
Darth Malgus betrayed us. He's taken the crystal fleet Emperor-knows-where.
Let me guess, Malgus has taken the crystal fleet. You can never trust the principled ones.
I knew Malgus was bad news.
How did the Republic learn our plans?
Imperial Intelligence is dissolved. The Empire is a leaky faucet of "secrets."
All the more reason the Empire needs to reimagine itself for the changing times.
Once we build the stealth armada, we won't need change.
I wonder how long the Empire can survive on outdated traditions.
I tend to agree with Malgus.
It has more than survived these thousand years. It has flourished.
Moff Regus is a creature of habit, I'm afraid.
What's the use of a stealth armada if the Republic's spies can learn its location?
We have bigger problems.
Imperial Intelligence is not my problem. I'm here to win Ilum.
I'm curious how you plan to do that.
I am a servant of the Emperor. I will see the armada built.
I don't care either way.
And the Emperor will surely reward your service.
Stow the philosophy. You hired me to fight a war.
Save the debate.
Perhaps we should move on. Our conversation is not stimulating enough for the hunter.
The Empire rose to power without alien coalitions. It can keep its power without them, too.
Malgus is a fool.
It's going to take superior technology and superior numbers to defeat the Republic.
Moff Regus, you're wrong.
The Republic's base is built into a cliff-side. The main fleet is going to batter the exposed side to oblivion.
The objective is to claim the Republic crystal supplies, kill Admiral Shai, and open the docking bay doors so Imperial forces can clean up.
You'll be entering through this tunnel and hitting deep within the mountain, where the fleet can't reach.
And while you and the main fleet give the Republic a beating, I'll prep the crystal fleet for the transfer of the Republic's crystals.
A two-pronged attack. Are you on board?
I came to Ilum to win this war. I'm not going to quit now.
Of course I am.
If you're ready, Darth Malgus.
The Dark Council has placed me at your command.
Whatever your philosophical shortcomings, you are a solid tactician.
You're not as bad as you seem.
I earned my title.
As long as I get to shed some blood.
Do I get to kill things?
I don't care what you do or how you do it, so long as we force the Republic off Ilum.
Then let's start the attack. Good luck.
Our best recon teams are scouting the Republic base for an attack. But in the meantime, we need to prepare for the arrival of the prototype fleet.
We should press the advantage while we have it.
You are too cautious.
Lay out the plan.
What's the reason for bringing the fleet to Ilum? Can't the stealth technology be transported?
Why's the fleet so important?
We need the fleet in place on the surface. Everything we need to build the stealth armada is on that fleet.
But the Republic's anti-aircraft artillery installation controls the skies. Anything that flies too low gets shot down.
The Republic's artillery base is protected by a ray shield and the Republic's best alien forces. Delta Squad will disable the ray shield while you storm the base and destroy the guns.
Sabotage is a specialty of mine.
I'll take care of it.
That's what I'm counting on. Your expertise versus the Republic's numbers.
Sounds like easy credits.
I'll take care of it.
It will be, if the plan works. But in war, things rarely go according to plan.
There will be other obstacles beyond the troops and the ray shields. Count on it.
It can't be that simple.
That's why I'm sending you in. We're putting our best piece on the board, so to speak.
If it needs destroying, I can destroy it.
I'll take care of it.
Getting to the artillery will be the hard part.
Who are Delta Squad and why haven't I heard of them?
Delta Squad?
Their exploits are usually of the black ops variety. If you'd heard of them, they wouldn't be half as good.
Why can't Delta Squad storm the base?
Can't they take out the guns?
We want to time the attack so you can strike the instant the ray shield goes down, before the Republic can scramble reinforcements.
Get into position at the comm relay just outside the artillery base. Contact Delta Squad when you're ready, and they'll bring the ray shield down.
After that, it's up to you. Destroy those guns and get out of there. Alive.
Are you deliberately trying to provoke me?
I am doing what I was sent to do. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have other matters to attend to.
And you, I did not request your help so that you could bring aliens into the Empire.
Then maybe I should leave you to do your own dirty work.
I can go, if you want.
No, that's not necessary.
I did not come here to take disrespect from a Moff.
Show respect.
None intended, my lord.
Then you shouldn't have requested my help at all.
Too bad.
Speak to me again in that tone.
Excuse me? [Force Choke]
I--I'm sorry, my lord.
I did what was needed, to strengthen the Empire.
They make us stronger.
I only did what I thought was right.
I'm sorry. I had to.
At least some people around here still have sense. Good work at the mine.
No group of aliens will ever be part of the Empire.
I despise freaks.
A sentiment some people could stand to remember.
They would've stabbed us in the back down the line.
I don't trust mercenaries.
Doubtlessly.
I've never liked negotiating.
I prefer killing to talking.
You are in charge of this operation, not Darth Malgus.
I take my orders from you.
The mine's been reclaimed. We can resume our crystal operations.
We need the crystals. We need that mine.
I want the Republic's Kaleesh army destroyed. Show the galaxy the price of allying with the Republic.
When I'm done with the Kaleesh, no one, alien or human, will dare ally with the Republic.
Consider the Kaleesh finished.
You know the mission.
What's the plan?
Let's not get ahead of ourselves.
I'm going to need a really big bomb. Can't take down an entire army by hand.
That could take a while.
It's a point. Your plan hardly seems efficient.
The "victory" on Corellia cost us nearly a tenth of our forces. That's hardly a rate of attrition we can support, is it?
Does this have something to do with the mission, Malgus?
The Kaleesh are war-like, ritualistic people. In my brief time on Kalee, I observed the ritual by which they chose their warleader.
Challenge their general. Win their respect, and they will defend that mine to the death. For the Empire.
Aliens! You want us to recruit aliens!
It sounds like we could use some allies.
Malgus makes a good point.
I am in charge of this operation, not Malgus.
I didn't realize the battle on Corellia was so costly.
Wait, didn't we win Corellia?
New planet, new contest. We can't fear the past.
The might of the Empire will prevail, regardless.
We don't need aliens.
The mine is at the end of a crystal cave, with several Republic outposts guarding it. Sure, challenge the Kaleesh general, then bring me his head!
You forget your place, Moff. I am the Emperor's Wrath.
I'll make my own decisions.
Apologies, my lord. We both want to win this war.
I am a member of the Dark Council. I don't take orders from either of you.
We will see.
Of course. I will trust in your wisdom on this matter.
Multiple bosses just confuses the job.
Money's the same either way?
You're here under a military commission. My commission.
Situation on the ground may make one or both options untenable.
I'll judge when I get there.
Darth Malgus's plan makes more sense.
I prefer the Sith's idea.
I will not trust the Empire to mercenary freaks.
As you say, Moff.
We must put the Empire first.
If we don't bolster our forces, there will be no future for the Empire.
Go to the mine. Gather the weapons of the Kaleesh warriors and plant them in the ice to initiate the rite of challenge.
This is a military matter, Malgus.
You appealed to the Dark Council for help. Here I am.
Master Kaedan is dead.
I finished the mission.
See, Malgus, we have everything under control.
Members of the Dark Council are not convinced.
Darth Malgus. I'll just be observing for the time being.
Observing, hmm. Before his death, Master Kaedan ordered an army of Kaleesh mercenaries to take our only functioning crystal mine.
Is there a problem here, gentlemen?
Calm down.
Just internal politics.
I'm on the Dark Council, and I don't recall sending you.
The Dark Council sent you?
Darths Marr, Ravage and Mortis sent me. My business is cleaning up the military's messes.
There something going on here I should know about?
What's this?
If there's one thing I've learned, the Dark Council are not people I want to cross.
Listen to the Sith.
You see how my hands are tied, Moff. It wasn't my choice to interfere.
Enough bickering. We have a war to fight.
Ahem.
Excuse me, my lord. The Dark Council has sent us some unexpected aid.
I see three flaws, Major. You've split your forces. You're vulnerable in the air. And you take our enemy for idiots.
You think that Jedi isn't expecting this? Out.
Yes, sir.
Incompetents, everywhere! I can't believe it's come to this. Asking for alien help to save our Empire.
This alien happens to be Sith.
Watch what you say.
Present company excepted.
Say that again. I dare you.
Watch what you say.
Here's your battlefield commission.
It won't be the first time I've saved the Empire.
It's what I do best.
I'd never believe it, but records don't lie.
Don't insult my allies.
Watch what you say.
What a sorry state.
Don't worry. It's not contagious.
Why do you hate aliens?
That was the least of my concerns.
My lord. Thank you for coming. If it weren't for the Sith, the Empire would collapse all around us.
If it weren't for the Sith, we might be able to get something done.
Sith are overrated.
That's not a popular opinion around here.
There's more of us here, you know.
What about us?
The best of the best, each of you.
Thank you, Moff Regus. I am honored.
It's a pleasure.
It's my honor. If there were more Sith, the Empire would be in better shape.
Spare me the flattery.
Enough empty praise.
We'll get right to business, then.
Agent. The demise of Imperial Intelligence notwithstanding, I look forward to seeing your best work.
I look forward to doing my best work.
You won't be disappointed.
I was promised a commission.
What about me?
And you have it. Here you go.
You are in the presence of a Sith.
Bow to your superior.
Yes, my lord. I'm honored.
Hunter. I hope we have a deal. We have your battlefield commission ready.
It's an honor. What's the situation?
Thank you.
My payment, too?
And my credits?
When the job's done.
I guess congratulations are in order.
A commission. Good job.
Later. We have a war to win.
A battlefield commission for a bounty hunter?
A commission?
The best of the best. I want everyone on this strike force representing the Imperial military.
Thanks for coming. I look forward to seeing your best work.
I want to serve the Empire in whatever way I can.
I'm eager to help.
You won't be disappointed.
This chatter's all well and good, but you still haven't told me what I'm doing here.
Get to the point.
Adegan crystals. Imperial scientists can now transform these glitzy bits of rock into the most powerful stealth technology in the galaxy.
We want every ship in the Imperial armada fitted with this tech: an unstoppable stealth armada.
You said something over holo about Republic interference.
You mentioned the Republic....
I take it you've run into trouble, or you wouldn't have called me.
So what's the hitch?
You weren't lying when you said it was the best invention since the hyperdrive.
I'm suitably impressed.
To succeed, we need two things: to control Ilum's crystal supply and to bring our fleet safely to Ilum for modification.
Ilum's no place for a war. Narrow passages, sharp jutting rocks and the coldest wind you ever felt.
But that Republic admiral wants a war. He's sent Jedi Master Jaric Kaedan to lead the Republic's elite alien armies on the ground. Kaedan's pinned us in.
The only reason Master Kaedan is still around is because he hasn't met me.
Not for long.
I'm counting on that.
Why must the Jedi always interfere?
Stupid Jedi.
If they want a war, we'll give it to them. How do you plan to counter Master Kaedan?
What's your strategy?
I plan to kill him.
The Jedi think of Ilum as their planet. Only two of them were here when we arrived, but they have ruins scattered around the place.
The ruins housing Master Kaedan's base are too small for anything but a strike team. And they're surrounded by cliffs full of Duros shocktroopers.
It sounds like this Jedi is defenseless without his shocktroopers.
We should eliminate the Duros.
No Jedi is really defenseless, but the shocktroopers are key.
Then have your soldiers stand aside and let a professional take care of this.
I'll take care of it.
You don't expect me to go on a suicide mission without a strategy.
So what's the plan?
Our only chance is to lure the Duros shocktroopers into the open, where they're vulnerable.
I've established fake supply depots between here and the ruins. Master Kaedan is overaggressive. He's already mobilized the shocktroopers to capture the depots.
Clean out the Duros at the supply depots and then assault the ruins base.
Which is why I'm appealing to you directly instead of through the Dark Council.
Is that so?
You'll have it.
I'll make my own decisions.
We will see.
Nice to see you too.
